contracts.title: Contractor Frameworks for Responding to Dangerous Buildings - Demolition Contractor
contracts.description:
Lancaster City Council recognises that a number of incidents occur day and night throughout the year.  To enable the council to respond to such situations it is now seeking contractors to work with on a responsive basis 
Submissions are sought from suitably qualified and experienced Demolition contractors to register their interest and present completed schedules in order to establish contractor framework to be utilised in extreme cases were the Council may be called on to undertake demolitions
contracts.cpv_description: Construction work and Building construction work and Environmental services

contracts.cpv_description: Scaffolding and Equipment for scaffolding and Scaffolding structures

contracts.title: Contractor Frameworks for Responding to Dangerous Buildings
contracts.description:
Lancaster City Council has responsibility under the Building Act 1984 to protect the public from dangerous buildings and structures.
During office hours such reports of dangerous building are reported to its Building Control Team within the Regeneration and Planning Service.  Outside normal working hours the council responds via its Duty Emergency Incident Officer (DEIO).
In recent years the district has witnessed a number of high profile dangerous building incidents including the Megazone fir
contracts.cpv_description: Construction structures and materials; auxiliary products to construction (except electric apparatus) and Demolition, site preparation and clearance work and Business services: law, marketing, consulting, recruitment, printing and security

contracts.title: Reshaping Lancaster District's Museums Offer: Consultancy Support Services
contracts.description: Lancaster City Council highly values its museums as part of the district’s unique heritage and culture, its visitor economy and its Place offer for those who live and work in the district.  Nevertheless, it is recognised that the museums service needs to be improved and revitalised, creating an engaging audience focused offer whilst improving long term financial sustainability.   To begin to address this, the City Council commissioned a major high level review of its museums and identified a num
contracts.cpv_description: Museum services and preservation services of historical sites and buildings

contracts.title: Lancaster City Centre Masterplan and Investment Framework
contracts.description:
Lancaster is one of the country’s most important historic and cultural destinations with over 2,000 years of history behind it. The city is now looking forward and is developing an ambitious vision for the next 25 years aimed at realising its potential and putting in place the infrastructure to bid for World Heritage Site and City of Culture status.

Lancaster City Council is leading a partnership of organisations committed to fully realising the economic potential of the city by developing an
contracts.cpv_description: Urban planning and landscape architectural services

contracts.title: Bold Street Housing Development Opportunity
contracts.description: Lancaster City Council is seeking a housing developer for a small opportunity site in an established residential area. The Bold Street housing development site is located in Lancaster district in the seaside town of Morecambe, Lancashire. Situated in the West End of Morecambe directly off Marine Road West and the Promenade. The site is covered by the postcodes LA3 1TS for Bold Street and LA3 1TJ for the back-land area.The site is approximately 2,700 square meters (0.27 hectares) in size.
contracts.cpv_description: Construction work for multi-dwelling buildings and individual houses

contracts.title: Invitation to Tender for a PSN Compliant ITHC
contracts.description: Lancaster City Council requires the provision of an annual IT Health Check (ITHC) to meet the requirements of the Public Services Network code of connection. We require interested suppliers to not only provide the ITHC, but also provide onsite consultancy by a Check Qualified practitioner to assist in developing the scope of the ITHC. We require the ITHC to be undertaken week commencing the 23rd November 2015 with the full remedial reports to be provided to Lancaster City Council by 7th December
contracts.cpv_description: IT services: consulting, software development, Internet and support

contracts.title: Ride on Mowers (4) for Lancaster City Council July 2015
